skill.name: nathan-standards
skill.description: Development standards for the Nathan n8n-Jira agent automation system. Covers n8n workflows, Python patterns, and project conventions.
skill.summary: Development standards for the Nathan n8n-Jira agent automation system. Covers n8n workflows, Python ...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing development standards and code pattern examples. No executable code, scripts, or runtime capabilities. All code examples are embedded in markdown files for reference only.

content.value_statement: Teams building n8n-Jira automation need consistent patterns and conventions. This skill provides standardized templates, workflow structures, and Python patterns to ensure maintainable and secure automation code.
actual_capabilities: Provides n8n workflow templates with webhook patterns
Defines Python code conventions and module structures
Documents credential management and security patterns
Includes registry and contract specifications for automation
Offers YAML configuration patterns for workflow management
Prescribes spec-driven development using agent-os commands
limitations: Reference documentation only, no code execution
Does not include runtime n8n or Python libraries
Requires separate n8n instance for actual automation
Patterns are templates requiring adaptation to specific projects

use_cases.title: Build n8n workflows
use_cases.description: Create webhook-based n8n workflows following validated patterns with proper secret validation and response formats.

use_cases.title: Write Python modules
use_cases.description: Develop Python helper services with consistent type hints, async patterns, and dataclass structures.

use_cases.title: Configure registries
use_cases.description: Set up workflow registries and command contracts for distributed automation systems.

prompt_templates.title: Create n8n workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the standard n8n webhook workflow pattern from Nathan standards for creating a new Jira integration workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Python module template
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the recommended Python module template from Nathan standards for async webhook client implementations?

prompt_templates.title: Registry configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me the YAML registry format from Nathan standards for defining command endpoints and parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Expression escaping
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the correct JQL expression escaping patterns from Nathan standards for use in n8n expressions?

output_examples.input: Show me the standard n8n webhook workflow pattern
output: Webhook --> Validate Secret --> Operation --> Respond to Webhook
Required pattern: Webhook node validates X-N8N-SECRET header against N8N_WEBHOOK_SECRET environment variable
Response format: { success: boolean, data: object, status_code: number, error: string | null }

best_practices: Always use shared secret authentication for n8n webhooks via X-N8N-SECRET header
Keep credentials in n8n only, never in Python services that call webhooks
Include metadata contracts in workflow settings to document input/output contracts
Use frozen dataclasses with slots for immutable data models in Python code
anti_patterns: Do not embed credentials in webhook URLs or request bodies
Avoid template literals in n8n expressions, use string concatenation instead
Do not skip secret validation in webhook workflows
Avoid mutable dataclasses when data models should be immutable

faq.question: Is n8n required to use this skill?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides patterns and standards. You need a running n8n instance only if building actual workflows.

faq.question: Can these patterns work with other Jira tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Patterns focus on webhook contracts and Python structures that adapt to any REST API integration.

faq.question: Are the Python patterns async-compatible?
faq.answer: Yes. All Python patterns use async/await and include proper async HTTP client implementations.

faq.question: Is credential data safe with these patterns?
faq.answer: Yes. Patterns mandate n8n-only credential storage with shared secret webhook authentication.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything?
faq.answer: No. This is a reference skill with documentation. No runtime dependencies required.

faq.question: How does this compare to other workflow skills?
faq.answer: Focuses on n8n-Jira specific conventions rather than general automation. Provides strict security patterns.
